sspike API¶

Classes¶

Detector¶

Usage example:

from sspike.detectors import Detector

detector = Detector('kamland')
class sspike.detectors.Detector(detector)¶

Detector specific information.

Parameters

name (str) – Detector name in SNOwGLoBES (and sspike (copying SNOwGLoBES ( ;) ))).

N_p¶

Number of target protons.

Type

float

N_e¶

Number of target electrons.

Type

float

snow_channels¶

Channels used in SNOwGLoBES simulations.

Type

list of str

basic_channels¶

Channels for cross-checking sspike with SNOwGLoBES.

Type

list of str

nc_channels¶

Neutrino-proton neutral-current interaction channels by flavor.

Type

list of str

Snowball¶

class sspike.snowball.Snowball(model, progenitor, transform, distance, t_bins=1)¶

Simulation parameters and directory information.

Parameters

  • model (str) – Name of supernova model type from snewpy.

  • progenitor (dict) – Model specific simulation parameters.

  • transform (str) – Name of transformation type for snewpy to apply.

  • distance (float) – Distance to supernova in kpc.

models_dir¶

Local snewpy models directory.

Type

str

snowglobes_dir¶

Local SNOwGLoBES directory.

Type

str

sim_path¶

Simulation file containing initial neutrino fluxes.

Type

str

snowball_dir¶

sspike directory for simulation fluences and processed dataframes.

Type

str

sn_name¶

Name indicating model type and progenitor parameters.

Type

str

tarball¶

File path to tarball created by snewpy.

Type

str

fluence_dir¶

Directory path to extracted snewpy tarball.

Type

str

fluences()¶

Read fluence file and return dataframe.

Note

Energy in 0.2 MeV bins and fluences are number per square centimeter.

Modules¶

pnut¶

Process neutrino underground telemetry.

Functions to load SN models from and process event rates.

sspike.pnut.basic_events(snowball, detector)

Estimate ibd and electron scatter events for cross-checking.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – File path to processed dataframe.

Return type

str

sspike.pnut.dxs_nc(E, T_p, a=1)

Neutral-current double differential cross-section.

Parameters

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • T_p (float) – Proton recoil energy in GeV.

Returns

dsig – Differential cross-section in with respect to proton recoil energy with units of cm^2 / GeV.

Return type

float

sspike.pnut.e_scat(snowball, detector)

Electron-neutrino scattering events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with electron events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.elastic_events(snowball, detector)

Proton-neutrino elastic scattering events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with neutral-current events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.ibd_events(snowball, detector)

Inverse beta decay events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with electron events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.nc_events(T_p, E, f, E_min, scale=1)

Integrate neutrino differential cross-section and fluence w.r.t. energy.

Parameters

  • T_p (float) – Proton recoil energy $[MeV]$.

  • E (np.array) – Neutrino energies $[MeV]$.

  • f (np.array) – Neutrino fluence $$

Returns

  • E (np.array) – Electron equivalent energy in KamLAND.

  • Note – Quenching factors using WebPlotDigitizer on Fig. 6 in: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0168900210017018

sspike.pnut.quench(T_p)

Convert proton recoil energy to electron equivalent energy.

Parameters

T_p (np.array) – Proton recoil energies of interest $[MeV]$.

Returns

  • E (np.array) – Electron equivalent energy in KamLAND.

  • Note – Quenching factors using WebPlotDigitizer on Fig. 6 in: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0168900210017018

sspike.pnut.snowglobes_events(snowball, detector, t_bins=None)

Process fluences with SNOwGLoBES via snewpy.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

snowflakes – File path to processed dataframe.

Return type

list of str

sspike.pnut.sspike_events(snowball, detector)

Process event rates using sspike functions.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • detector (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspikes – File paths to processed dataframe.

Return type

list(str)

sspike.pnut.time_events(bliz, detector)

Process time series with snowglobes.

beer¶

Back-end event reader.

Make plots and tables of pnut outputs.

sspike.beer.bin_times(bliz)

Return array of times for plotting.

sspike.beer.draw(events_path, channels, nc_flavors=False, save=False, test=False)

Plot event rates.

Parameters

  • events_path (str) – Location of dataframe csv.

  • channels (list of str) – Interaction channels to plot.

Note

Proton neutral rates cannot be combined with other rates yet.

sspike.beer.series_plot(bliz, sno, times, plot_type)

Plot channels from tables.

sspike.beer.sort_channels(channels)

Combine similar channels for plotting and tables.

Parameters

channels (list of str) – Interaction channels to plot.

Returns

combos – List of all neutrino flavor interactions for each nucleus or electrons.

Return type

dict of list of str

sspike.beer.tab(snowball)

Count binned event rates and create a table.

Parameters

snowball (Snowball) –

Returns

tab – File path to results: totals.txt.

Return type

str
